==Events==
* [[705]] &ndash; Empress [[Wu Zetian]] abdicates the throne, restoring the [[Tang Dynasty]].
*[[1371]] &ndash; [[Robert II of Scotland|Robert II]] becomes King of Scotland, beginning the [[House of Stuart|Stuart]] dynasty.
*[[1495]] &ndash; King [[Charles VIII of France]] enters [[Naples]] to claim the city's throne.
*[[1632]] &ndash; [[Galileo Galilei|Galileo]]'s ''[[Dialogue Concerning the Two Chief World Systems]]'' is published.
*[[1651]] &ndash; [[St. Peter's Flood]]: A storm surge floods the [[German Bight|Frisian coast]], drowning 15,000 people.
*[[1744]] &ndash; [[War of the Austrian Succession]]: The [[Battle of Toulon, 1744|Battle of Toulon]] begins.
*[[1797]] &ndash; The [[Last Invasion of Britain]] begins near [[Fishguard]], Wales.
*[[1819]] &ndash; By the [[Adams–Onís Treaty]], Spain [[History of Florida|sells Florida]] to the United States for five million U.S. dollars.
*[[1821]] &ndash; [[Greek War of Independence]]: [[Alexander Ypsilantis]] crosses the [[Prut]] river at [[Sculeni]] into the [[Danubian Principalities]].
*[[1847]] &ndash; [[Mexican–American War]]: The [[Battle of Buena Vista]] &ndash; 5,000 American troops defeat 15,000 [[Mexico|Mexicans]].
*[[1848]] &ndash; The [[French Revolution of 1848]], which would lead to the establishment of the [[French Second Republic]], begins.
*[[1853]] &ndash; [[Washington University in St. Louis]] is founded as Eliot Seminary in [[St. Louis, Missouri]].
*[[1855]] &ndash; The [[Pennsylvania State University]] is founded in [[State College, Pennsylvania]] (as the Farmers' High School of Pennsylvania)
*[[1856]] &ndash; The [[United States Republican Party|Republican Party]] opens its first national meeting in [[Pittsburgh]].
*[[1862]] &ndash; [[Jefferson Davis]] is officially inaugurated for a six-year term as the [[President of the Confederate States of America]] in [[Richmond, Virginia]]. He was previously inaugurated as a provisional president on February 18, 1861.
*[[1872]] &ndash; The [[Prohibition Party]] holds its first national convention in [[Columbus, Ohio]], nominating [[James Black (prohibitionist)|James Black]] as its presidential nominee.
*[[1879]] &ndash; In [[Utica, New York]], [[Frank Woolworth]] opens the first of many of 5 and dime [[F.W. Woolworth Company|Woolworth]] stores.
*[[1889]] &ndash; United States President [[Grover Cleveland]] signs a bill admitting [[North Dakota]], [[South Dakota]], [[Montana]] and [[Washington (state)|Washington]] as [[U.S. state]]s.
*[[1899]] &ndash; [[Philippine Revolutionary Army|Filipino forces]] led by General [[Antonio Luna]] [[Second Battle of Caloocan|launch counterattacks for the first time]] against the American forces during the [[Philippine–American War]]. The Filipinos fail to regain Manila from the Americans.
*[[1904]] &ndash; The United Kingdom sells a meteorological station on the [[South Orkney Islands]] to [[Argentina]], the islands are subsequently claimed by the United Kingdom in 1908.
*[[1909]] &ndash; The sixteen [[battleship]]s of the [[Great White Fleet]], led by {{USS|Connecticut|BB-18|6}}, return to the United States after a voyage around the world.
*[[1915]] &ndash; [[World War I]]: Germany institutes [[unrestricted submarine warfare]].
*[[1921]] &ndash; After Russian forces under Baron [[Roman von Ungern-Sternberg]] drive the Chinese out, the [[Bogd Khan]] is reinstalled as the [[khan (title)|emperor]] of Mongolia.
*[[1924]] &ndash; U.S. President [[Calvin Coolidge]] becomes the first President to deliver a radio broadcast from the [[White House]].
*[[1942]] &ndash; [[World War II]]: President [[Franklin D. Roosevelt]] orders General [[Douglas MacArthur]] out of the [[Philippines]] as the Japanese victory becomes inevitable.
*[[1943]] &ndash; World War II: Members of the [[White Rose]] resistance, [[Sophie Scholl]], [[Hans Scholl]], and [[Christoph Probst]] are executed in [[Nazi Germany]].
*[[1944]] &ndash; World War II: American aircraft mistakenly bomb the Dutch towns of [[Nijmegen]], [[Arnhem]], [[Enschede]] and [[Deventer]], resulting in 800 dead in Nijmegen alone.
*[[1948]] &ndash; [[Communism|Communist]] revolution in [[Czechoslovakia]].
*[[1957]] &ndash; [[Ngo Dinh Diem]] of [[South Vietnam]] survives a [[Vietcong|communist]] shooting assassination attempt in [[Ban Me Thuot]].
*[[1958]] &ndash; [[Egypt]] and [[Syria]] join to form the [[United Arab Republic]].
*[[1959]] &ndash; [[Lee Petty]] wins the first [[Daytona 500]].
*[[1972]] &ndash; The [[Official Irish Republican Army]] detonates a [[car bomb]] at [[Aldershot]] barracks, killing seven and injuring nineteen others.
*[[1973]] &ndash; [[Cold War]]: Following President [[Richard Nixon]]'s [[Nixon visit to China 1972|visit]] to the People's Republic of China, the two countries agree to establish [[:wikt:liaison|liaison]] offices.
*[[1974]] &ndash; The [[Organisation of Islamic Cooperation|Organisation of the Islamic Conference]] summit begins in [[Lahore]], Pakistan. Thirty-seven countries attend and twenty-two heads of state and government participate. It also recognizes [[Bangladesh]].
*  1974   &ndash; [[Samuel Byck]] tries and fails to assassinate U.S. President Richard Nixon.
*[[1979]] &ndash; Independence of [[Saint Lucia]] from the United Kingdom.
*[[1980]] &ndash; [[Miracle on Ice]]: In [[Lake Placid, New York]], the United States hockey team defeats the [[Soviet Union]] hockey team 4–3.
*[[1983]] &ndash; The notorious [[Broadway theatre|Broadway]] flop ''[[Moose Murders]]'' opens and closes on the same night at the [[Eugene O'Neill Theatre]].
*[[1986]] &ndash; Start of the [[People Power Revolution]] in the [[Philippines]].
*[[1994]] &ndash; [[Aldrich Ames]] and his wife are charged by the [[United States Department of Justice]] with spying for the Soviet Union.
*[[1995]] &ndash; The [[Corona (satellite)|Corona]] [[reconnaissance satellite]] program, in existence from 1959 to 1972, is declassified.
*[[1997]] &ndash; In [[Roslin, Scotland]], scientists announce that an adult sheep named [[Dolly the sheep|Dolly]] has been successfully [[cloning|cloned]].
*[[2002]] &ndash; [[Angola]]n political and rebel leader [[Jonas Savimbi]] is killed in a military ambush.
*[[2006]] &ndash; At least six men stage Britain's [[Securitas depot robbery|biggest robbery]], stealing £53m (about $92.5 million or €78 million) from a Securitas depot in [[Tonbridge]], [[Kent]].
*[[2011]] &ndash; An [[2011 Christchurch earthquake|earthquake]] measuring 6.3 in magnitude strikes [[Christchurch]], New Zealand, killing 185 people.
*  2011   &ndash; [[Bahraini uprising (2011–present)|Bahraini uprising]]: Tens of thousands of people [[March of loyalty to martyrs|march in protest]] against the deaths of seven victims killed by police and army forces during previous protests.
*[[2012]] &ndash; A [[2012 Buenos Aires rail disaster|train crash]] in [[Buenos Aires]], [[Argentina]], kills 51 people and injures 700 others.
*[[2014]] &ndash; President [[Viktor Yanukovych]] of [[Ukraine]] is impeached by the [[Verkhovna Rada]] of Ukraine by a vote of 328-0, fulfilling a major goal of the [[Euromaidan]] rebellion.
